intro: Sarcostigma vogelii, commonly known as the African star grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands and along riverbanks. Sarcostigma vogelii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
